title: Unrestricted access to any "connected pack" on docs

profile.name: Coda
profile.about: The doc that brings words, data, & teams together.

vulnerability_information:
## Summary:
When adding a pack, a post request is sent to ```https://coda.io/internalAppApi/documents/[doc ID]/packs``` with data ```{"packId":[pack Id]}``` where doc ID is the id of doc user wishes to add pack and pack ID is the pack user wants to install.
But this request is unrestricted and the user can iterate over packId to get any free/pro/disabled pack.

## Steps To Reproduce:
  1. Capture the post request while installing any pack using a proxy like Burp when you are logged in.
  2. Change packId to desired pack's ID. A valid packId gives a 200 status and invalid gives 400.

The below post request contains packId of Google Translate Pack which is a pro pack.

```
POST /internalAppApi/documents/F5Y1qJ3aw-/packs HTTP/1.1
Host: coda.io
Connection: close
Content-Length: 15
Accept: application/json
Origin: https://coda.io
X-Csrf-Token: InEwS0Z2U21xR09JUDI2Qkwi
User-Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (X11; Linux x86_64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/78.0.3904.108 Safari/537.36
Content-Type: application/json
Sec-Fetch-Site: same-origin
Sec-Fetch-Mode: cors
Referer: https://coda.io/d/Untitled_dF5Y1qJ3aw-/asdf_suTAx
Accept-Encoding: gzip, deflate
Accept-Language: en-US,en;q=0.9
Cookie: /* Your Cookie */

{"packId":1063}
```

Sending the request should return a 200 OK. Check the doc, the pro pack is installed.

[This doc](https://coda.io/d/Untitled_dNvxRin_XtJ) created by 0x00cryptohackeronetester@gmail.com uses Google Translate pro pack without upgrading. Installing the pro pack gives a 14 days warning. I am not sure if it will expire and become read only.

## Impact

Allows anyone to use paid functionality for free causing loss to business.

activities.message:
Hello @0xcrypto
On sending the request to the endpoint you've specified, I get the following response:

```
HTTP/1.1 400 Bad Request
Server: nginx
Date: Mon, 20 Jan 2020 10:51:09 GMT
Content-Type: application/json; charset=utf-8
Content-Length: 72
Connection: close
X-Download-Options: noopen
X-Content-Type-Options: nosniff
X-XSS-Protection: 1; mode=block
Referrer-Policy: strict-origin-when-cross-origin
Content-Security-Policy: base-uri 'none'; child-src 'self' * blob:; connect-src 'self' https://cdn.coda.io wss://coda.io https://coda.io wss://*.intercom.io https://coda-us-west-2-prod-blobs.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com https://coda-us-west-2-prod-blobs-upload.s3-us-west-2.amazonaws.com https://*.intercom.io https://uploads.intercomcdn.com https://uploads.intercomusercontent.com https://app.getsentry.com https://iframe.ly https://cdn.iframe.ly https://api.rollbar.com https://baconipsum.com https://api.trello.com https://www.google-analytics.com https://api.stripe.com; default-src 'self' https://cdn.coda.io; font-src data: https://cdn.coda.io https://js.intercomcdn.com https://fonts.gstatic.com https://fonts.googleapis.com; form-action 'self' https://api-iam.intercom.io https://intercom.help; frame-ancestors 'self' *.coda.io ; frame-src *; img-src * blob: data:; media-src https://js.intercomcdn.com; object-src 'none'; report-uri /csp-violation; script-src 'strict-dynamic' 'nonce-2a58be6f2a464b9e8c72b71f81480504' 'unsafe-inline' 'unsafe-eval' https:; style-src 'self' 'unsafe-inline' blob: https://cdn.coda.io https://fonts.googleapis.com; worker-src 'self' blob:
Feature-Policy: autoplay 'self'; fullscreen 'self'; geolocation *
Set-Cookie: X
Vary: Accept, Accept-Encoding
Strict-Transport-Security: max-age=63072000; includeSubDomains; preload

{"statusCode":400,"statusMessage":"Bad Request","message":"Bad Request"}
```

Could you please confirm if this is still reproducible on your side? and if so, please provide a video PoC for more clarity.

Thanks,
@0xcain

Hi @0xcain,

Here is the video PoC. Working PackIds are ```1031 ,1032 ,1034 ,1036 ,1038 ,1039 ,1049 ,1052 ,1053 ,1054 ,1056 ,1058 ,1059 ,1060 ,1063``` where PackId ```1049``` is Google Search Console and ```1063``` is Google Translate.
For some reason upload feature is not working on hackerone...

Hello @0xcrypto, 
Please upload the video PoC here since links won't be clicked for security reasons. 
To ensure a smooth upload, make sure the PoC is in MP4 format.

Thanks,
@0xcain

Hi @0xcain,
Here's the PoC recording in MP4.
I still can't see the video I uploaded in MP4. Here's the screenshot.

Hello @0xcrypto
Thanks for the video PoC, i've been able to reproduce this behaviour and add the packs to my documents. 
However, I get a warning saying that my payment plan doesn't support the added pack, hence the document will remain read only until i pay for them.

Have you been able to bypass this restriction and generate a public document with a usable pro pack using this finding?

Regards,
@0xcain

Hi @0xcain,
https://coda.io/d/Untitled_dNvxRin_XtJ/Section-1_suPcG#_lumF_ is the document that uses Google Translate pack. It is publicly accessible. I got the same warning. I think this is to check if the user's plan is not expired. The doc works for 14 days. It can be easily bypassed by removing the pack and readding after 14 days.

additional_data.new_title: Unrestricted access to any "connected pack" on docs

activities.message:
Hello @0xcrypto,

Thank you for your submission! We were able to validate your report, and have submitted it to the appropriate remediation team for review. They will let us know the final ruling on this report, and when/if a fix will be implemented. Please note that the status and severity are subject to change.

Regards,
@orangeband

Hello,

Any updates from Coda team on fixing this issue?
Thanks for the report @0xcrypto. We were able to validate your bug and a fix is rolling to production shortly. Thanks for participating in our program.

@0xcrypto discovered a way to add a paid Pack to a doc and use it for a limited time (2 weeks) before the doc becomes read-only. Allowing use of paid Packs in free workspaces was intentional to allow someone downgrading from a paid plan to a cheaper/free plan time to adjust their doc, but it could also exposed this entrypoint, which could allow a free user to make use of a paid Pack temporarily.
